history:
House Bill/Resolution NO. HB02872
FULL TITLE : AN ACT PROHIBITING TELECOMMUNICATION COMPANIES FROM IMPOSING AN EXPIRATION PERIOD ON THE VALIDITY OF PREPAID CALL AND TEXT CARDS AND THE FORFEITURE OF LOAD CREDITS THEREOF
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : YAP, VICTOR A.
DATE FILED : 2016-08-11
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
NATURE : Economic
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE
COMMITEE HEARINGS/ACTIONS:
      1. Scheduled for meeting/hearing on 2017-09-27
      2. Under deliberation by the Mother Committee on 2018-02-14
      3. Deliberated upon by the Mother Committee on 2018-03-14
          -After a thorough deliberation, Chairman Victor Yap proposed for the creation of a Technical Working Group (TWG) to dig deeper on the issues of load expiration, vanishing loads, drop calls, running cost of calls and handling of complaints filed by subscribers/consumers.
      4. Under study by the Technical Working Group(TWG) on 2018-04-24
      5. Under study by the Technical Working Group(TWG) on 2018-05-15
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE ON RULES
REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATIONS TECHNOLOGY ON 2016-08-17
